newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks seen starting higher on Dow gains.
newsitem.headline: French stocks seen starting higher on Dow gains.

text.p: French shares were expected to strengthen at Wednesday's opening, building on the Dow's two percent rise yesterday, traders said.

"It will firmer on the back of Wall Street," said a broker, adding that other European markets were indicated higher and Paris operators would likely try to push the CAC index up to the 2,800 level today.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 22.56 points or 0.82 percent at 2,784.76. The CAC-40 futures contract on GLOBEX was up 34 points at 2,810 from Tuesday's close.
INSEE figures showed French consumer prices rose a final unrevised 0.2 percent in May on the month and 0.9 percent on the year.
